summary: Defines the core message infrastructure for the Chainlit framework, providing base classes and specialized message types that represent UI elements, user prompts, file uploads, actions, and error notifications. Includes logic for serialization, asynchronous dispatch, timeout handling, token management, and optional persistence to cloud storage.
business_intent: Facilitate interactive conversational applications by managing how messages are created, sent, and tracked, enabling developers to collect user responses, trigger actions, handle file inputs, and report errors within a chat-driven workflow.
